http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Regular walk: one circuit of Fresh Pond. Meet at the service entrance to Fresh Pond, across from the TD Bank and the intersection of Wheeler Street and Concord Ave, next to the Fresh Pond Rotary. We'll start walking from there.

Bring your walking shoes and yourselves, and your lunch, if you like, and get out and move. Your doctor says it's good for you, so it must be.
results.name: Lunchtime walk at Fresh Pond - Friday, 12:30

results.description:
At the last crypto meetup, we took a look at some FREE tools that you can use to maintain your privacy online, and discussed other available options.

Let's install OTR - Off The Record - secure instant messaging, and then we can all test it as a group. It is a pretty easy install and we can review the settings and options as we go along.


OTR works on GNU/Linux, Windows and Mac - it is a two-step install, meaning that we will have to install two things - they both have very small footprint.

Once we have installed OTR, we can take a look at the Tor Project - a very easy install of the Tor Browser.

Using Tor protects you against a common form of Internet surveillance known as "traffic analysis." Traffic analysis can be used to infer who is talking to whom over a public network.
Tor helps to reduce the risks of both simple and sophisticated traffic analysis by distributing your transactions over several places on the Internet, so no single point can link you to your destination.

THIS IS THE IMPORTANT PART:


The variety of people who use Tor is actually part of what makes it so secure. Tor hides you among the other users on the network, so the more populous and diverse the user base for Tor is, the more your anonymity will be protected.


So - In  the spirit of giving, let's get real and use these free tools and learn how to teach others to do the same.

Link to hangout - 12/18/2015 at 1pm ET : https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/event/cjfhrydio4rhi9bpgih1coop154?hl=en
results.how_to_find_us: https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/event/cjfhrydio4rhi9bpgih1coop154?hl=en

results.description:
North By Northwest Tickets


December 18, 2015
4:00 pm – 6:20 pm
Barbara and Theodore Alfond Auditorium (Auditorium G36)

North by Northwest by Alfred Hitchcock (USA, 1959, 136 min.). In this classic caper/thriller, Cary Grant stars as a hapless New York advertising agent who is mistaken for an undercover federal agent and terrorized by foreign spies. What follows is a cinematic study in cold war anxieties, identity crises, and the dissolution of American ideals. This fourth and final pairing of Grant and Hitchcock culminates in the climactic scene where our “wrong man” hero and his femme fatale cling perilously to the face of Mount Rushmore.

" great film, and certainly one of the most entertaining movies ever made, directed by Alfred Hitchcock at his peak." - Dave Kehr

See you at the movies,

John
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a motley crew sitting in the middle of  around the 4th row in the Alfond Auditorium.  We will Meetup in the hallway AFTER close of credits to decide on a place for dinner and discussion.
results.name: North By Northwest

results.description:
We get together to create community of people who share the skill of empathic abilities. You don't have to convince others of your abilities as everyone in the group has those abilities. Let's discuss the desirable side of having these skills and share discoveries how to improve them. Current written scientific information on mirror-touch synesthesia is about being uncomfortable with these abilities. I found it opposite. It's great to have these type of skills.

$5 per person

Use downstairs door
results.name: Let's get together to share our empathic sensitivity

results.description:
UPDATE:

We have moved downstairs to the Potbelly Sandwich Shop, because the Japanese restaurant upstairs (Akai Ryu) will be closed on Friday. Fortunately for us, Potbelly is AWESOME, and they are working with us so that our events don't have to be canceled completely on such short notice! Special thanks to the GM, Alyssa... She ROCKS!

Sadly, I must cancel the 21-28 event at 6:30 due to insufficient seating. Other events are getting pared down, as well.

Walk-Ins -- Please be aware that there will be limited space in this new venue. We will probably not be able to accommodate most walk-ins like we have done in the past. You can try your luck, but there are no guarantees! Sorry!

Potbelly will be offering us three free coupons, each good for a free sandwich, and each awarded to a lucky attendee! To qualify, you must:

(1) get a paid ticket via Eventbrite (http://www.BargainDating.com), and

(2) attend and turn in your completed scorecard.

 Winners will be notified by me personally. :)

=======================================

BargainDating runs Boston's first affordable speed dating events. We're now in Porter Sq, at a sandwich shop, complete with a free parking garage, right next to the Red Line!

Each BargainDate round will last between 4 and 10 minutes, depending on the number of participants. Each overall event will take less than an hour, so be prepared to meet new people in a short time! You'll fill out a form and pass it in at the end of the event. Then you'll receive an email with all your mutual matches within 48 hours!

There will be different time slots and tables for different age ranges. Make sure you get the proper ticket!

Okay, so what are the age ranges? They're as follows:

    From 6:30 - 7:30 pm:

  **** CANCELED **** (1A) Ages 21 - 28 **** CANCELED ***

  (1B) Ages 26 - 35

  (1C) Ages 33 - 44

  (1D) Ages 42 - 55

    From 8:00 - 9:00 pm:

  (2A) Ages 24 - 32

  (2B) Ages 30 - 40

  (2C) Ages 38 - 50

  (2D) Ages 48 - 63

VENUE:

The Potbelly Sandwich Shop (http://www.potbelly.com/shops/shoplocator.aspx#&&ss=False&lng=[masked]&sl=False&s=02127&p=1&b=0&sid=310&d=0&lat=[masked]&f=0&v=True) is located in the Porter Square Galleria, right next to the Porter Square Red Line station. Behind the venue, there is a small parking garage with unlimited parking for us. The venue offers sandwiches and drinks, so you won’t have to go hungry.

TICKETS:

Please sign up in advance to get the $10 price. Walk-ins will be allowed as long as the ratio of men to women is right but will pay $20 each per event (or $30 for two events.) Why do walk-ins pay more? Because they make a lot more work for me! So sign up in advance and get the darn-cheap $10 price.

Lastly, please note that tickets stop selling at 2:00 pm on the day of the events. If you don't get a ticket online, you can try your luck as a walk-in...

REFUNDS:

The official policy is no refunds, unless an event gets cancelled. But you can always ask...

GUARANTEE:

I would love to guarantee that you'll meet a minimum number of people, and I do my best to keep the numbers balanced, but at the end of the day, it's really tough. I can only guarantee that there will be at least three people of each sex registered before an event happens, otherwise it will get cancelled before event day. But there are things outside my controI, like no-shows and people who get the wrong ticket and then want to change once they've arrived. And did I mention no-shows? :)

WHY REGISTER IN ADVANCE:

When you register in advance, you are guaranteed admission, you pay less, and you are much more likely to connect with your mutual matches. When you register online, all your contact info (name, email, cell) is in the system and ready to be used to match you up. When you show up as a walk-in, you have to hand-write all your info, and if I can't read it, I can't match you up.

When you register in advance, you're guaranteed to get in. Once the events sell out, there are no guarantees. It would be a shame to get there only to get turned away. We'll always try to accommodate people who show up, but there are no guarantees of admission.

FAQ:

(0) You canceled/refunded my ticket!!! Why???

For these events on Dec 18th, the previous venue canceled with only 48 hours notice. I was able to find another venue, but it is much smaller and cannot hold all the people that would have easily fit into the old venue. So the number of participants must be pared down so that we can fit into the venue! Next time, if we go back to this same new venue, I will restructure all the events so that we can all fit!

(1) Do I need to print and bring my ticket on event day?

Nope. There will be a guest list and preprinted dating scorecards for the participants who have preregistered. You won't need your emailed ticket. But you SHOULD bring something to write with!

(2) I RSVP'ed on Meetup. Am I registered for this event?

Nope! Meetup RSVP's mean nothing. You need to get tickets on Eventbrite to be registered.

(3) When should I register for these events?

Sooner is better than later, but definitely don't wait till the last minute, as events do sell out. You should absolutely sign up NO LATER THAN TWO DAYS before the events. Why? Because if there aren't enough people registered the day before event day, I'll be cancelling the smaller events. If I cancel after you've signed up, you get refunded. But once I cancel, the event is gone. If you had signed up earlier, the event might have happened. Capisce?

(4) Do you offer refunds?

Nope. The official policy is no refunds, especially on or after event day. But you can always ask...

(5) I only see five people signed up for this event. Are you still going to hold it?

Yes.  You are looking at one Meetup group. This event is posted in multiple Meetup groups (usually 20 or so), as well as other external sites. There will be many people there!

(6) I didn't receive my matches within 48 hours like you promised! What should I do???

First, check your SPAM/junk mail folder. If you don't find your matches, send me a message via Meetup or via text message, not via regular email. If you attended, I sent you your matches via regular email. If you didn't get them the first time, then you probably won't get them no matter how many times I resend them via email. So try Meetup messaging or texting, and I'll reply with your matches there.

(7) It's been fifteen minutes since the event ended and I haven't received my matches yet!!! What should I do???

Wait another 47 hours and 45 minutes. Then see the previous question.

OR get one of the EXPEDITED MATCHES tickets and receive your matches much sooner!

(8) How many people are signed up for the XYZ event?

Sorry, but if I answer every person who asks that question, I will waste a lot of time doing so. In general, there tend to be more women than men signed up, but that is not always the case. And of course the numbers are changing constantly as people register!

(9) Will there be an even number of men and women? I don't want to attend otherwise.

Then you should not attend. There's never a perfect balance between men and women. First off, women are much more willing to sign up than men. Then, there are no-shows, and people who sign up for the wrong event. In short, it's impossible to have a perfect balance unless I've got 5 extra men and women for each individual event ready to hop in if needed. Of course, that's where having many volunteers helps a lot.

(10) Why did you do away with the free BUDDY offer?

I had implemented the BUDDY system as a way to keep balance between men and women, but not enough people were using it, and often those that did use it made mistakes while registering which made it even HARDER to keep the balance between men and women. So it's gone. Now, everyone registers himself, and that's it.

(11) If I am attending only one event but decide while I'm there to attend a second, do I have to pay the walk-in rate?

No. If you've already signed up for one event, you're in the system, so you'll just pay the extra $10 for the second event. It's people that aren't preregistered and aren't in the system that pay the walk-in rate.

(12) I didn't like anyone at the event. Should I still turn in my datecard?

YES! Missing datecards slow down the matching process. When I'm making the matches, I notice when someone has not turned in his card, and I'll send a message asking about it. So save us both some time and turn in your datecard. It's better if you turn in your card, so that I know that we have your card and that it was not lost or overlooked.

(13) I forgot to turn in my datecard. What do I do???

Scan in or take a picture of your datecard and send it to me via email, or send me a Meetup message with the list of people you chose, and I'll make your matches! But please do it ASAP, so I can finish within the 48-hour promised time window.

(14) If I ask a question which you answer in this post, will you answer my email anyway?

Heh heh heh.... Don't hold your breath! If you couldn't take the time to read the FAQ, why should I take the time to reply to your message?

Any other questions? Just ask... after you've read the FAQ, of course!
results.how_to_find_us: Potbelly is on the first floor. You'll see our check-in area when you walk in from the inside entrance. :)
results.name: BargainDating's Last Speed Dating Events in 2015. Win a Free Sandwich Coupon.

results.description:
This Friday@Drinkabout Boston

The Boston Beards will be hosting Silicon Drinkabout this week at Health Innovators in Cambridge. Be sure to drop by, invite your colleagues, your friends, and come and meet like minded people who just want to chill after a long work week of making the world a better place. 

Who's it for?

Techies, entrepreneurs, and people who just hustle and grind in the daily startup life, all are welcome! 

What is Silicon Drinkabout?

Silicon Drinkabout is a weekly meet-up for startups and techies to meet like-minded people, have some fun and relax at the end of the working week.


We are in London, Madrid, Toronto, Sofia, São Paulo, Dublin, Berlin, Brussels, Luxembourg, Seville Lima, Dubai, Skopje, Amsterdam, Belgrade, Bogotá, Tel Aviv, Munich & now Boston!
results.name: Silicon Drinkabout Boston

For these events on Dec 18th, the previous venue canceled with only 48 hours notice. I was able to find another venue, but it is much smaller and cannot hold all the people that would have easily fit into the old venue. So the number of participants must be pared down so that we can fit into the venue! Next time, if we go back to this same new venue, I will restructure all the events so that we can all fit!

(1) Do I need to print and bring my ticket on event day?

Nope. There will be a guest list and preprinted dating scorecards for the participants who have preregistered. You won't need your emailed ticket. But you SHOULD bring something to write with!

(2) I RSVP'ed on Meetup. Am I registered for this event?

Nope! Meetup RSVP's mean nothing. You need to get tickets on Eventbrite to be registered.

(3) When should I register for these events?

Sooner is better than later, but definitely don't wait till the last minute, as events do sell out. You should absolutely sign up NO LATER THAN TWO DAYS before the events. Why? Because if there aren't enough people registered the day before event day, I'll be cancelling the smaller events. If I cancel after you've signed up, you get refunded. But once I cancel, the event is gone. If you had signed up earlier, the event might have happened. Capisce?

(4) Do you offer refunds?

Nope. The official policy is no refunds, especially on or after event day. But you can always ask...

(5) I only see five people signed up for this event. Are you still going to hold it?

Yes.  You are looking at one Meetup group. This event is posted in multiple Meetup groups (usually 20 or so), as well as other external sites. There will be many people there!

(6) I didn't receive my matches within 48 hours like you promised! What should I do???

First, check your SPAM/junk mail folder. If you don't find your matches, send me a message via Meetup or via text message, not via regular email. If you attended, I sent you your matches via regular email. If you didn't get them the first time, then you probably won't get them no matter how many times I resend them via email. So try Meetup messaging or texting, and I'll reply with your matches there.

(7) It's been fifteen minutes since the event ended and I haven't received my matches yet!!! What should I do???

Wait another 47 hours and 45 minutes. Then see the previous question.

OR get one of the EXPEDITED MATCHES tickets and receive your matches much sooner!

(8) How many people are signed up for the XYZ event?

Sorry, but if I answer every person who asks that question, I will waste a lot of time doing so. In general, there tend to be more women than men signed up, but that is not always the case. And of course the numbers are changing constantly as people register!

(9) Will there be an even number of men and women? I don't want to attend otherwise.

Then you should not attend. There's never a perfect balance between men and women. First off, women are much more willing to sign up than men. Then, there are no-shows, and people who sign up for the wrong event. In short, it's impossible to have a perfect balance unless I've got 5 extra men and women for each individual event ready to hop in if needed. Of course, that's where having many volunteers helps a lot.

(10) Why did you do away with the free BUDDY offer?

I had implemented the BUDDY system as a way to keep balance between men and women, but not enough people were using it, and often those that did use it made mistakes while registering which made it even HARDER to keep the balance between men and women. So it's gone. Now, everyone registers himself, and that's it.

(11) If I am attending only one event but decide while I'm there to attend a second, do I have to pay the walk-in rate?

No. If you've already signed up for one event, you're in the system, so you'll just pay the extra $10 for the second event. It's people that aren't preregistered and aren't in the system that pay the walk-in rate.

(12) I didn't like anyone at the event. Should I still turn in my datecard?

YES! Missing datecards slow down the matching process. When I'm making the matches, I notice when someone has not turned in his card, and I'll send a message asking about it. So save us both some time and turn in your datecard. It's better if you turn in your card, so that I know that we have your card and that it was not lost or overlooked.

(13) I forgot to turn in my datecard. What do I do???

Scan in or take a picture of your datecard and send it to me via email, or send me a Meetup message with the list of people you chose, and I'll make your matches! But please do it ASAP, so I can finish within the 48-hour promised time window.

(14) If I ask a question which you answer in this post, will you answer my email anyway?

Heh heh heh.... Don't hold your breath! If you couldn't take the time to read the FAQ, why should I take the time to reply to your message?

Any other questions? Just ask... after you've read the FAQ, of course!

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

results.description:
UPDATE:

We have moved downstairs to the Potbelly Sandwich Shop, because the Japanese restaurant upstairs (Akai Ryu) will be closed on Friday. Fortunately for us, Potbelly is AWESOME, and they are working with us so that our events don't have to be canceled completely on such short notice! Special thanks to the GM, Alyssa... She ROCKS!

Sadly, I must cancel the 21-28 event at 6:30 due to insufficient seating. Other events are getting pared down, as well.

Walk-Ins -- Please be aware that there will be limited space in this new venue. We will probably not be able to accommodate most walk-ins like we have done in the past. You can try your luck, but there are no guarantees! Sorry!

Potbelly will be offering us three free coupons, each good for a free sandwich, and each awarded to a lucky attendee! To qualify, you must:

(1) get a paid ticket via Eventbrite (http://www.BargainDating.com), and

(2) attend and turn in your completed scorecard.

 Winners will be notified by me personally. :)

=======================================

BargainDating runs Boston's first affordable speed dating events. We're now in Porter Sq, at a sandwich shop, complete with a free parking garage, right next to the Red Line!

Each BargainDate round will last between 4 and 10 minutes, depending on the number of participants. Each overall event will take less than an hour, so be prepared to meet new people in a short time! You'll fill out a form and pass it in at the end of the event. Then you'll receive an email with all your mutual matches within 48 hours!

There will be different time slots and tables for different age ranges. Make sure you get the proper ticket!

Okay, so what are the age ranges? They're as follows:

    From 6:30 - 7:30 pm:

  **** CANCELED **** (1A) Ages 21 - 28 **** CANCELED ***

  (1B) Ages 26 - 35

  (1C) Ages 33 - 44

  (1D) Ages 42 - 55

    From 8:00 - 9:00 pm:

  (2A) Ages 24 - 32

  (2B) Ages 30 - 40

  (2C) Ages 38 - 50

  (2D) Ages 48 - 63

VENUE:

The Potbelly Sandwich Shop (http://www.potbelly.com/shops/shoplocator.aspx#&&ss=False&lng=[masked]&sl=False&s=02127&p=1&b=0&sid=310&d=0&lat=[masked]&f=0&v=True) is located in the Porter Square Galleria, right next to the Porter Square Red Line station. Behind the venue, there is a small parking garage with unlimited parking for us. The venue offers sandwiches and drinks, so you won’t have to go hungry.

TICKETS:

Please sign up in advance to get the $10 price. Walk-ins will be allowed as long as the ratio of men to women is right but will pay $20 each per event (or $30 for two events.) Why do walk-ins pay more? Because they make a lot more work for me! So sign up in advance and get the darn-cheap $10 price.

Lastly, please note that tickets stop selling at 2:00 pm on the day of the events. If you don't get a ticket online, you can try your luck as a walk-in...

REFUNDS:

The official policy is no refunds, unless an event gets cancelled. But you can always ask...

GUARANTEE:

I would love to guarantee that you'll meet a minimum number of people, and I do my best to keep the numbers balanced, but at the end of the day, it's really tough. I can only guarantee that there will be at least three people of each sex registered before an event happens, otherwise it will get cancelled before event day. But there are things outside my controI, like no-shows and people who get the wrong ticket and then want to change once they've arrived. And did I mention no-shows? :)

WHY REGISTER IN ADVANCE:

When you register in advance, you are guaranteed admission, you pay less, and you are much more likely to connect with your mutual matches. When you register online, all your contact info (name, email, cell) is in the system and ready to be used to match you up. When you show up as a walk-in, you have to hand-write all your info, and if I can't read it, I can't match you up.

When you register in advance, you're guaranteed to get in. Once the events sell out, there are no guarantees. It would be a shame to get there only to get turned away. We'll always try to accommodate people who show up, but there are no guarantees of admission.

Any other questions? Just ask... after you've read the FAQ, of course!

OR get one of the EXPEDITED MATCHES tickets and receive your matches much sooner!

(8) How many people are signed up for the XYZ event?

Sorry, but if I answer every person who asks that question, I will waste a lot of time doing so. In general, there tend to be more women than men signed up, but that is not always the case. And of course the numbers are changing constantly as people register!

(9) Will there be an even number of men and women? I don't want to attend otherwise.

Then you should not attend. There's never a perfect balance between men and women. First off, women are much more willing to sign up than men. Then, there are no-shows, and people who sign up for the wrong event. In short, it's impossible to have a perfect balance unless I've got 5 extra men and women for each individual event ready to hop in if needed. Of course, that's where having many volunteers helps a lot.

(10) Why did you do away with the free BUDDY offer?

I had implemented the BUDDY system as a way to keep balance between men and women, but not enough people were using it, and often those that did use it made mistakes while registering which made it even HARDER to keep the balance between men and women. So it's gone. Now, everyone registers himself, and that's it.

(11) If I am attending only one event but decide while I'm there to attend a second, do I have to pay the walk-in rate?

No. If you've already signed up for one event, you're in the system, so you'll just pay the extra $10 for the second event. It's people that aren't preregistered and aren't in the system that pay the walk-in rate.

(12) I didn't like anyone at the event. Should I still turn in my datecard?

YES! Missing datecards slow down the matching process. When I'm making the matches, I notice when someone has not turned in his card, and I'll send a message asking about it. So save us both some time and turn in your datecard. It's better if you turn in your card, so that I know that we have your card and that it was not lost or overlooked.

(13) I forgot to turn in my datecard. What do I do???

Scan in or take a picture of your datecard and send it to me via email, or send me a Meetup message with the list of people you chose, and I'll make your matches! But please do it ASAP, so I can finish within the 48-hour promised time window.

(14) If I ask a question which you answer in this post, will you answer my email anyway?

Heh heh heh.... Don't hold your breath! If you couldn't take the time to read the FAQ, why should I take the time to reply to your message?

Any other questions? Just ask... after you've read the FAQ, of course!
results.how_to_find_us: Potbelly is on the first floor. You'll see our check-in area when you walk in from the inside entrance. :)
results.name: BargainDating's Last Speed Dating Events in 2015. Win a Free Sandwich Coupon.

results.description:
UPDATE:

We have moved downstairs to the Potbelly Sandwich Shop, because the Japanese restaurant upstairs (Akai Ryu) will be closed on Friday. Fortunately for us, Potbelly is AWESOME, and they are working with us so that our events don't have to be canceled completely on such short notice! Special thanks to the GM, Alyssa... She ROCKS!

Sadly, I must cancel the 21-28 event at 6:30 due to insufficient seating. Other events are getting pared down, as well.

Walk-Ins -- Please be aware that there will be limited space in this new venue. We will probably not be able to accommodate most walk-ins like we have done in the past. You can try your luck, but there are no guarantees! Sorry!

Potbelly will be offering us three free coupons, each good for a free sandwich, and each awarded to a lucky attendee! To qualify, you must:

(1) get a paid ticket via Eventbrite (http://www.BargainDating.com), and

(2) attend and turn in your completed scorecard.

 Winners will be notified by me personally. :)

=======================================

BargainDating runs Boston's first affordable speed dating events. We're now in Porter Sq, at a sandwich shop, complete with a free parking garage, right next to the Red Line!

Each BargainDate round will last between 4 and 10 minutes, depending on the number of participants. Each overall event will take less than an hour, so be prepared to meet new people in a short time! You'll fill out a form and pass it in at the end of the event. Then you'll receive an email with all your mutual matches within 48 hours!

There will be different time slots and tables for different age ranges. Make sure you get the proper ticket!

Okay, so what are the age ranges? They're as follows:

    From 6:30 - 7:30 pm:

  **** CANCELED **** (1A) Ages 21 - 28 **** CANCELED ***

  (1B) Ages 26 - 35

  (1C) Ages 33 - 44

  (1D) Ages 42 - 55

    From 8:00 - 9:00 pm:

  (2A) Ages 24 - 32

  (2B) Ages 30 - 40

  (2C) Ages 38 - 50

  (2D) Ages 48 - 63

VENUE:

The Potbelly Sandwich Shop (http://www.potbelly.com/shops/shoplocator.aspx#&&ss=False&lng=[masked]&sl=False&s=02127&p=1&b=0&sid=310&d=0&lat=[masked]&f=0&v=True) is located in the Porter Square Galleria, right next to the Porter Square Red Line station. Behind the venue, there is a small parking garage with unlimited parking for us. The venue offers sandwiches and drinks, so you won’t have to go hungry.

TICKETS:

Please sign up in advance to get the $10 price. Walk-ins will be allowed as long as the ratio of men to women is right but will pay $20 each per event (or $30 for two events.) Why do walk-ins pay more? Because they make a lot more work for me! So sign up in advance and get the darn-cheap $10 price.

Lastly, please note that tickets stop selling at 2:00 pm on the day of the events. If you don't get a ticket online, you can try your luck as a walk-in...

REFUNDS:

The official policy is no refunds, unless an event gets cancelled. But you can always ask...

GUARANTEE:

I would love to guarantee that you'll meet a minimum number of people, and I do my best to keep the numbers balanced, but at the end of the day, it's really tough. I can only guarantee that there will be at least three people of each sex registered before an event happens, otherwise it will get cancelled before event day. But there are things outside my controI, like no-shows and people who get the wrong ticket and then want to change once they've arrived. And did I mention no-shows? :)

WHY REGISTER IN ADVANCE:

When you register in advance, you are guaranteed admission, you pay less, and you are much more likely to connect with your mutual matches. When you register online, all your contact info (name, email, cell) is in the system and ready to be used to match you up. When you show up as a walk-in, you have to hand-write all your info, and if I can't read it, I can't match you up.

When you register in advance, you're guaranteed to get in. Once the events sell out, there are no guarantees. It would be a shame to get there only to get turned away. We'll always try to accommodate people who show up, but there are no guarantees of admission.

FAQ:

(0) You canceled/refunded my ticket!!! Why???

For these events on Dec 18th, the previous venue canceled with only 48 hours notice. I was able to find another venue, but it is much smaller and cannot hold all the people that would have easily fit into the old venue. So the number of participants must be pared down so that we can fit into the venue! Next time, if we go back to this same new venue, I will restructure all the events so that we can all fit!

(1) Do I need to print and bring my ticket on event day?

Nope. There will be a guest list and preprinted dating scorecards for the participants who have preregistered. You won't need your emailed ticket. But you SHOULD bring something to write with!

(2) I RSVP'ed on Meetup. Am I registered for this event?

Nope! Meetup RSVP's mean nothing. You need to get tickets on Eventbrite to be registered.

(3) When should I register for these events?

Sooner is better than later, but definitely don't wait till the last minute, as events do sell out. You should absolutely sign up NO LATER THAN TWO DAYS before the events. Why? Because if there aren't enough people registered the day before event day, I'll be cancelling the smaller events. If I cancel after you've signed up, you get refunded. But once I cancel, the event is gone. If you had signed up earlier, the event might have happened. Capisce?

(4) Do you offer refunds?

Nope. The official policy is no refunds, especially on or after event day. But you can always ask...

(5) I only see five people signed up for this event. Are you still going to hold it?

Yes.  You are looking at one Meetup group. This event is posted in multiple Meetup groups (usually 20 or so), as well as other external sites. There will be many people there!

(6) I didn't receive my matches within 48 hours like you promised! What should I do???

First, check your SPAM/junk mail folder. If you don't find your matches, send me a message via Meetup or via text message, not via regular email. If you attended, I sent you your matches via regular email. If you didn't get them the first time, then you probably won't get them no matter how many times I resend them via email. So try Meetup messaging or texting, and I'll reply with your matches there.

(7) It's been fifteen minutes since the event ended and I haven't received my matches yet!!! What should I do???

Wait another 47 hours and 45 minutes. Then see the previous question.

OR get one of the EXPEDITED MATCHES tickets and receive your matches much sooner!

(8) How many people are signed up for the XYZ event?

Sorry, but if I answer every person who asks that question, I will waste a lot of time doing so. In general, there tend to be more women than men signed up, but that is not always the case. And of course the numbers are changing constantly as people register!

(9) Will there be an even number of men and women? I don't want to attend otherwise.

Then you should not attend. There's never a perfect balance between men and women. First off, women are much more willing to sign up than men. Then, there are no-shows, and people who sign up for the wrong event. In short, it's impossible to have a perfect balance unless I've got 5 extra men and women for each individual event ready to hop in if needed. Of course, that's where having many volunteers helps a lot.

(10) Why did you do away with the free BUDDY offer?

I had implemented the BUDDY system as a way to keep balance between men and women, but not enough people were using it, and often those that did use it made mistakes while registering which made it even HARDER to keep the balance between men and women. So it's gone. Now, everyone registers himself, and that's it.

(11) If I am attending only one event but decide while I'm there to attend a second, do I have to pay the walk-in rate?

No. If you've already signed up for one event, you're in the system, so you'll just pay the extra $10 for the second event. It's people that aren't preregistered and aren't in the system that pay the walk-in rate.

(12) I didn't like anyone at the event. Should I still turn in my datecard?

YES! Missing datecards slow down the matching process. When I'm making the matches, I notice when someone has not turned in his card, and I'll send a message asking about it. So save us both some time and turn in your datecard. It's better if you turn in your card, so that I know that we have your card and that it was not lost or overlooked.

(13) I forgot to turn in my datecard. What do I do???

Scan in or take a picture of your datecard and send it to me via email, or send me a Meetup message with the list of people you chose, and I'll make your matches! But please do it ASAP, so I can finish within the 48-hour promised time window.

(14) If I ask a question which you answer in this post, will you answer my email anyway?

Heh heh heh.... Don't hold your breath! If you couldn't take the time to read the FAQ, why should I take the time to reply to your message?

Any other questions? Just ask... after you've read the FAQ, of course!

group.name: Free And Cheap Things in Boston (www.FACT-Boston.com)

results.description:
The Lafayette House normally does not take reservations, but they have graciously accepted the one I have made for our get together so let's meet at 6:15 pm in the lobby (I'll get there at 6 pm) to meet each other and get our tables for dinner!  Please do not be late, we are seated at 6:30 pm, we need to all be there for the hostess to seat us.

Food is fantastic and so is the atmosphere there at The Lafayette House.  A really nice evening out is planned so be sure to rsvp if you have interest in this Holiday Event!  

ONLY 20 SEATS (this is the maximum) will be available and then a wait list will be in place 'in case someone cancels' and you will automatically move up a spot! 

Friday, December 18th at 6:15 pm sharp is the date, come join us for a fun evening, interesting conversations, delicious food, and lots of laughing!

COST IS $25.00 per person (your drinks are separate cost).  This is going to be buffet style and you can go up and pick & serve yourself to your liking of the huge hot dinner buffet that is being offered!  

There will be the following offered:  Prime Rib, Chicken, Fish, another hot carved item (still being determined), two pasta dishes, two vegetables, three types of salad, and a huge variety of desserts!  Well worth the $25/per person!
results.name: COME JOIN US! Festive Holiday Dinner @ The Lafayette House! (Maximum is 20)!

results.description:
Let's play the old fashioned game of pokeno...it's very similar to Bingo except with playing cards instead of numbers on the board. We play about 20 games in about 2 hours. When you win a pokeno (straight line) you win a prize from the pokeno gift table. When you win four corners, you win the quarters. There are a few variations, but I can walk you through it - it's just like bingo except with gifts and quarters for winners. There will be something for everyone. Easy Peasy!

Here's what you bring:

a new, unwrapped gift valued at $10 for the prize table
$10 in quarters
little bingo chips or other markers for your card (I always have extras!) I bring all the rest of the supplies!

6:15 ish: arrive, settle in, order food
6:45 pm: first card is called!

Panera is a counter-style restaurant with delicious sandwiches, soups, salads, smoothies, coffee and desserts.
results.name: Play pokeno!  Fri 12/18 Panera Saugus

results.description:
Special holiday joint meetup:

Drink du temps des Fêtes avec Sylvie et le groupe: Québécoise and Lovers of Québec in Boston

Venez prendre un verre avec vos amis Québécois/es et francophones pour le temps des Fêtes!

Le vendredi soir au Tavern in the Square dans Porter Square, Cambridge: A partir de 6 heures et 30 nous vous invitons tous a nous rejoindre pour une heure de l'apéritif et pour l'occasion de parlez Français et de faire des nouvelles rencontres

Discounted parking available in the back. (Get your parking ticket validated by the wait staff.) Please note:

-Please RSVP only for one of the groups, Voulez-vous or Québécoise...not both.

-Pay $1.00 when you come.

-Anything you order is at your own expense. Please pay your bill as you go.

-Also, if your plans change, kindly update your RSVP

Merci,

Richard
results.how_to_find_us: We will be at the tables near the front window. Please contribute $1.00 when you come to help pay for the website. Merci!
results.name: Drink du temps des Fêtes  : Happy Hour au Tavern avec groupe Québécoise

results.description: The details are mainly in the "How to find us" section above. After Mass we'll try to meet one another. Meanwhile, suggestions are being taken for the Holidays/Christmas & New Years' Meetups! Please come and enjoy!
results.name: Monk's Delight on Friday Night! Meet for Holy Mass at 6:30 PM & Follow-up social

results.description:
Come join us at the Boston area’s first and only walk in Clay and Fused Glass art studio. All skill levels welcome. Check out www.indigofirestudio.com Bring your friends, bring your kids. Bring your friends' kids. Bring your kids' friends. Instruction available. Come make your masterpiece. The studio is located in Belmont, next to Fresh Pond. We are close to Cambridge, Arlington, Lexington, and Waltham, with plenty of parking

For Adults we offer Classes, Independent Study, Workshops and Parties/Group Events.

We have six Pottery wheels, a Clay hand building table, Glass Fusing area, and PaintYour Own Pottery. Many of the Paint Your Own Pottery is handmade by our staff!

Claywork starts at $10.00 -- Glasswork at $15. Make your masterpiece!
results.name: Let's make clay and glass art at Indigofire in Belmont - Multigroup

results.description:
Salut tout le monde! 


Venez prendre un verre avec vos amis Québécois/es et francophones pour le temps des Fêtes!
Le Tavern on the Square de Porter square sera parfait. Nous avons aussi invité les Francophones du groupe Voulez-vous!
Ps svp nous apprécierons une contribution volontaire de 1$ pour payer les frais de maintenir le site et aider à payer pour de prochaines activités (72$/6 mois).
Les consommations et la nourriture seront à vos frais.
En espérant vous y voir!

results.description:
Pokeno time again!
I know, short notice, but let's see if we can get a group of at least 12 together for pokeno. If not, then we can play other games like Michigan Rummy, Telestrations, or card games. But, let's sign up for pokeno and see how it goes!

Panera is a counter-style restaurant so time won't be lost due to ordering food etc. You can eat while you play!

Please bring a new unwrapped gift valued at $10
$10 in quarters
and little markers for your card (I have extras)

6:30 pm: arrive, settle in
6:45 pm: first card is called
8:30 pm: finish up, collect your winnings!
results.name: Pokeno;  Panera Saugus Fri 12/18 6:30 pm

results.description:
We will laugh over 12 different ways, using over 12 different muscles groups. There is a laughter zone that allows us to be part of the experience. Laughter leads us to a skill that will transform your life for the better.

We also do traditional walking and laughing exercises.  Two new ones (Belly Dancing and Incredible Hulk laughter)  will give you such a work out that we include "Micro Movements" to help you recover.

We will take a happiness break by learning how to feel happy sensations created by the body. Mixing in Mind/Body awareness we will use interactive mindfulness to change our perceptions of ourselves as well as others.

This is for all ages.

$5 per person to cover expenses.

$5 per family. You have your whole life ahead of you. Don't you want to spend it knowing how to tap into desirable body sensations

We Have 3 co-leaders in our laughter club.  Walter Ness, Anya Weber and Jon Hindmarsh.
results.how_to_find_us: SomervilleLaughterClub.com
results.name: Let's get together and Laugh together

results.description:
Our theme this week will be on Gratitude and Appreciation.  One of the best and easiest ways to meditate and feel good!  Join us to deeply relax, renew, and leave feeling uplifted  and positive!  Who couldn't use some of that?! And, remember, I help make it easy for you, too! 


To further deepen your experience and to connect to and learn from each other, after each meditation we'll take some time to reflect and discuss the insights, meditation strategies, and the value received from the meditation. 

You'll have some good quality "me" time to slow down, tune in, and connect deeply with yourself and others.

I'll be inviting others to join us, and I encourage you to do so, as well!


Here's the basic description and format for all of our meditation sessions, with a more specific focus/theme each time we meet, as well.  Of course, you do not have to commit to attending every time, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit; and the better we'll get to know each other! 


To encourage and support your practice and our community, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.  Feel free to invite family and friends, too!


Guided Meditations for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY!


Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

I also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self, and to access all that it has to offer you.

By participating in these group guided meditations, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

• Techniques to help you release stress and anxiety, and to shift your perspective and experience of those issues to a more positive perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each time we meet to help you build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

We typically have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy. It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations! I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

"I truly value our time together. I tried two other guided meditation classes with other instructors, and I enjoy your classes the most. Why? Because you give us time to reflect, journal and share. It really helps to deepen my experience and expand my perspective. And honestly, I relate more to your meditations and love the sound of your voice. Your guided meditations are like group therapy for the soul."

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., has been leading guided meditation classes for years, and is also a certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be downstairs in the basement level Roots Studio, enter thru back parking lot, or if go in front door - walk down hallway and stairs will be on the left
results.name: Raise your Vibration and Feel Good by Meditating on Gratitude and Appreciation

results.description:
Please join me  for another great dine out at SUGAR CANE! 

MENU: www.sugarcanepeabody.com

I'm adding a "Secret Santa" to the mix vs. the basic Yankee Swap. This will be FUN with LOTS OF LAUGHS!  PLEASE be sure to read all the details below!

* SECRET SANTA:    Secret Santa is a Western Christmas tradition in which members of a group/ community are randomly assigned a person to whom they anonymously give a gift! 

* DETAILS:  If you are on the RSVP list, you will be assigned the name of another member on the list. If you ALREADY know the member you should have a general idea of what they like/would like. If you DON'T know your assigned member? This is a great opportunity to attend a meet up your assigned member is attending & get to know them!  

*THE RULES: To keep this Fair & Fun for all, there can't be any swapping of names, etc. : - ) ALSO, please try to resist the urge to share who your gift is for. This gift-giving fun is named, "SECRET" for a reason! LOL   The 'wrapped' gift amount needs to be in the $15 range. REMEMBER, the gift giver needs to stay anonymous... So, if you enclose a card, don't use your real name when you sign it.  Try to BE CREATIVE!  YOU decide if your gift should be funny, something practical they need/want, whatever.... 

* PLEASE NOTE: This meet up is MEMBERS ONLY ( sorry, no guests this time). I have made a reservation ( 7pm) for our group. As always, PLEASE be mindful of your RSVP. I understand that this is a very busy time of the year for most. However, if your plans change, and you will NOT be joining us, it takes less than a minute to update your rsvp : )  *The restaurant has agreed to separate checks

* If the weather is questionable, PLEASE check for any updates/cancellations  prior to attending....  I'm HOPING we won't have a storm and the roads will be clear/safe to drive. I will be adding a postpone date -TBD
results.name: DINE OUT With Your TTP Secret Santa! @ Sugar Cane

results.description:
DELICIOUS DINNER

(and Take-Out)

Prepared by

DAVID SNIECKUS

- MACROBIOTIC CHEF AND COUNSELOR - At 7 p.m.

at David’s, Margaret’s and Abigail's home in Newton, MA

December 18, 2015 Menu

Pea Soup

Udon Noodles

Tempeh with Onions

Broccoli, Kale, and Carrots

Mashed Winter Squash

Harvest Salad

Red Radish Pickles and Napa Chocolate Pudding with Raspberries

Kukicha Tea

(see detailed logistics below.)

**************************

Followed by a presentation from 8 to 10 pm on

Brahma Vihara - Upeka (Equanimity) with Whispering Deer

Equanimity is the capacity of the heart to hold it all – all of the joys and all of the sorrows without being swept away by the pleasant and pulling back from unpleasant experience. As an expression of the serene and balanced heart, equanimity brings a poise, a strength, a malleability, and a steadfastness to the mind/heart. It embraces a quality of kindness and ease that knows no limit. Come and join us and open to all our human experiences without resistance, and let these experiences just flow through.

Donation welcome.

About Whispering Deer

Meditation is my primary spiritual practice. Each year, I spend 8 weeks in silence, working with various meditation techniques, accessing deep states of consciousness and expanded awareness. This work has led me to experience the transformative power of the awakened heart, resulting in the development of the Brahma Vihara workshops. The benefits I have received are innumerable and immeasurable. Nothing would please me more than to share what I have learned with others.

For more information, go to: https://sites.google.com/site/whisperingdeermeditation/

**************************

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community

and enjoy the healthiest meal on planet earth!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Please rsvp no later than noon on Friday.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

(Note: Preferred payment is by cash or check.)
(Let David know if interested in helping him cook in exchange for a free meal. Prerequisite: One of David's cooking classes, unless experienced.)

(Please contact us if you'd like to lead a discussion opener based upon a topic of your choice.)

Feel free to pass on to other friends and kindred spirits!
results.name: Dinner and presentation: Brahma Vihara - Upeka - w/ Whispering Deer

For more information, go to: https://sites.google.com/site/whisperingdeermeditation/

                                          **************************

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community

and enjoy the healthiest meal on planet earth!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Please rsvp no later than noon on Friday.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

(Note: Preferred payment is by cash or check.)
(Let David know if interested in helping him cook in exchange for a free meal. Prerequisite: One of David's cooking classes, unless experienced.)

(Please contact us if you'd like to lead a discussion opener based upon a topic of your choice.)

Feel free to pass on to other friends and kindred spirits!

results.description:
• THE BOSTON DRUM CIRCLE

• A high-energy, FUN, celebration of drumming and community. For beginners who want to try something new, their friends, experienced drummers, dancers beginners to experts. NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

• We celebrate the traditions - rhythms that have built energy for hundreds of years for celebration, dance, ritual - just plain FUN! As well as whatever you bring to it!

We'll have drums to share, and support for newcomers, and energy for everyone.

Recent accolades!

“Great fun! Good rhythms. Very accommodating leader and group for this beginner. Will be back!”

Adrienne S 10/14

It was an amazing experience .. It was nice to feel free from the world and it's problems .. It's was so relaxing, can't wait to drum again ..thanks!

Justin 6/14

Was an awesome experience, I love hand drumming but really the main reason I came was to relieve stress due to family health situations and the circle definitely met my needs. Alan did a great job leading the circle with the drumming and the short history lessons about drumming and Africa. I will be coming back.

Paul 10/13

This Drum Circle is a great stress reliever after a long week of work and I wish it were every Friday night!! Boston Drum Cirlce attracts a wonderful , eclectic group of people that share the common bond of hand drumming. It is always wonderful to have the multi talented Fanta leading the Circle. Her singing, dancing, and drumming are all 5 star. Thank you for a great night of Drumming!

Carla 8/13

We can't wait to meet you! See you soon....

Alan and Fanta

venue.name: Roots and Wings Yoga and Healing ArtsCenter

results.description:
One of the best and easiest ways to feel good and to allow easier manifesting is to meditate on gratitude and appreciation!  Join us as I guide you thru three divine meditations (one will incorporate some "tapping"/EFT!) to deeply relax, renew, and leave feeling uplifted  and positive!  Who couldn't use some of that?! And, remember, I help make it easy for you, too! 

To further deepen your experience and to connect to and learn from each other, after each meditation we'll take some time to reflect and discuss the insights, meditation strategies, and the value received from the meditation. 

You'll have some good quality "me" time to slow down, tune in, and connect deeply with yourself/Spirit,  and others.

End time is approximate, as we often run over-time, and I welcome some "hang out and chat" time before leaving.

My plan is to continue to offer these transformational guided meditation and discussion-focused gatherings on a regular basis, in addition to other non-meditation focused ones. I  believe so strongly in the importance of connecting to Spirit and raising your vibration in this way.  I hope you'll take advantage of this opportunity.  As one member put it, "It's like therapy for your soul."   These sessions truly are like $200 workshops! I'll be offering the meditation focused sessions to my meditation meetup-members, as well.

Here's the basic description and format for all of the meditation sessions, with a more specific focus/theme each time.  Of course, you do not have to commit to attending every time, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit; and the better we'll get to know each other! 

To encourage and support your practice and our community, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.  Feel free to invite family and friends, too!

Guided Meditations for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY!

Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

I also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self, and to access all that it has to offer you.

By participating in these transformational group guided meditations, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

• Techniques to help you release stress and anxiety, and to shift your perspective and experience of those issues to a more positive perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each time we meet to help you build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

We typically have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy. It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations! I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

"I truly value our time together. I tried two other guided meditation classes with other instructors, and I enjoy your classes the most. Why? Because you give us time to reflect, journal and share. It really helps to deepen my experience and expand my perspective. And honestly, I relate more to your meditations and love the sound of your voice. Your guided meditations are like group therapy for the soul."

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., has been leading guided meditation classes for years, and is also a certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.

results.name: Raise Your Vibration and Feel Good by Meditating on Gratitude and Appreciation!

results.description:
PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! 

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html
results.how_to_find_us: We rented the whole 2nd floor of the Wild Rover to make this an awesome private party Look for Biagio at the top of the stairs.
results.name: Boston Mix n Mingle Holiday Party for 120 Members from 9+ Meetup Groups

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)
results.name: Friday Night Time Ultimate @ Russell Field

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

results.description:
Please join Bob from the Red Sox Natives and Laurie's 909 for The Beatles Tribute Band - The Glass Onion at Laurie's 9:09 in Wakefield on Friday, December 18 at 7:00pm.

For more information on the Glass Onion go to http://www.onionlove.net

Gathering near both the Penny Lane and Nickel Bars at Laurie's.

There is no cover.

Laurie's will be busy with it's dinner crowd. The live acoustic performance will begin at approximately 7:09 pm.

Stay for appetizers, dinner, a cocktail or two or three, socializing and more. If you have a group of people that want a table reservation for dinner please call Laurie's at[masked] and make a reservation. For information on Laurie's 909 and the menu go to www.lauries909.com.

Get there when you can and stay as long as you are able. You are more than welcome to show up for all or just part of the event.

If this will be your first time meeting the Red Sox Natives Crew and others please check out the photos of those who RSVP Yes so you can find the group.

Please remember to maintain your own tab or pay as you order and tip your servers. However, if you sit at a group table a group bill may be provided so please communicate with your server when ordering. Credit Cards will be held by the servers at Laurie's.

Laurie's 909 is one of Wakefield's newest Restaurant and Basr with live entertainment several nights per week and regular E Mail promotions for those on their list. Laurie's is located at the Wakefield Commuter Rail Train Station in Wakefield. The Reading and Haverhill Commuter Rail trains stop at Laurie's. Laurie's is easily accessible within 10 minutes from Routes 128, 93, 28 and 1. Free parking is available in two lots on Tuttle Street, in the Church parking lot if there are no activities there, and on street after 5:30pm. Check out the MBTA or Hop Stop for additional public transit options including the less reliable/frequent 136 and 137 bus lines.

Check out the "Penny Lane" Bar, the 9:09 and Beatles references.

More information at http://www.lauries909.com

See you there!
results.name: Beatles Tribute Band - The Glass Onion at Lauries 909

results.description:
A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual/practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source.  


_________________________________________

Here's what we are going to do:

_________________________________________

Intimate Puja Circles, created by Robyn, of Come Back to Love, will be the place to:

• Be playful with other yummy, juicy, soulful singles, and couples

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation - the principles and practices of Sacred Sexuality

• Be in a room with folks who are willing to be honest, and open their hearts

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra (whether you are single or in relationship):

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantric Speed Dating as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

Here's what Participants are saying!

"The class was great; I  really enjoyed it. Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale what I was hoping for....creating the possibility to feel a deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really good people at your events."

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."

The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.


Relax on a Friday night:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate!


Q&A

1. What if I'm in relationship? Being in relationship definitely does not exclude you from coming to the Intimate Puja Circle.  These rituals will be invitations to connect with yourself and one another - and you will be at choice as to how you do that.  There are typically a mix of singles and couples at the events.

2.  What should I wear? Please be comfortable but also celebratory!  Wear yoga pants or something with a draw string around the waist; bring sarongs, scarves, dresses, etc.

3.  Do I need to bring anything? Yes, FRIENDS!!  And your water bottle.  You are also welcome healthy snacks to share after the Puja.  Organic fruit and chocolate are best.

4.  What if I have questions, I'm feeling a bit nervous:  Please email me to set up a time to talk:  [masked]
results.name: SOLD OUT Intimate Puja Circle

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and shared energy. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in Boston?

At TurnON, we play three communication games, and you can participate at whatever level feels good to you. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where they feel comfortable to be themselves; a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. That's what we have created.

TurnON events give you the opportunity to look deeper into yourself, through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston.

TurnON Boston is an organization that teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. At the end of the evening, we will give you a brief description of the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and information on where to learn more. The games we play at TurnON events are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without actually doing the practice (or touching anyone, or removing any clothing!).

$10, payable at the door.

You can also learn to OM in Sunday's (12/20) Intro To OM class - a special discount is available for TurnON attendees only!

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square.


 http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxSF-Nicole-Daedone-Orgasm--2
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance is on the corner of Cedar and Dudley Streets.
results.name: TurnON Boston (+last chance discount for Sunday's OM class!)

results.description:
Bhagavad Gita 1.36

Topic - War, Violence, Capital Punishment (Part 2)

(This is the second part of the previous class)

We will learn about the qualities of "Tri-guna", the three energies of nature, in relation to war, conflict and violence. We will also cover the causes of war and violence according to the Gita and how they can be greatly minimized. We will also come to know what is this material realm and why, according to the Bhagavad Gita, war and violence cannot be eliminated in this realm.

We will cover the very detailed Vedic view regarding capital punishment; its true purpose, understanding its implementation, and discerning its relevance in modern society. Along with this discussion we will learn about the purpose of justice as defined by the Gita.
results.name: Bhagavad Gita Class

results.description:
This healing is being offered on a half-moon, the first quarter moon one week after the full moon. It is a time for gaining momentum and putting your best foot forward. My sound healings involve a range of Tibetan bowls and overtone chanting, but it is always specials to invoke the power of the moon in the healing we share!

"The first quarter moon is associated with the East and early morning.  The First Quarter Moon magic is a time for gaining strength to complete your actions and decisions. Any obstacles or issues that arise during this time are easily overcome by concentration on drawing the Moon's energies down to Earth to push forward your goals despite doubts.  Re-evaluation of your actions and recreation of your determination are supported by the magic of the First Quarter Moon.  Emotions begin to influence your determination at this time, and it is beneficial to put the emotions into the passion to complete your goals." Sandra Lindsey 


--------------------------------------------------------------------

So if you come to the Buddhist Temple for a sound healing, what can you expect? 

When you come in, you take your shoes off, then you walk to the Dharma Hall which will be on your immediate right at the top of the stairs. We'll start with a short introduction and discuss each of our intentions for how we want to work with the sound and then meditate for a few minutes to tune into each of our specific intentions. The general theme will be answering the wake-up call to the divine presence ... And trust me, if you come, you will hear it ringing ; ) Then, everyone will sit or lie down on super comfy pillow mats (bring your own blanket) and we'll begin our journey into sound.

I start by playing the 500 pound cast-iron temple bell and then I move into the sweet sounds of my Tibetan singing bowls. What follows, I can't exactly say, as the sound decides what it wants to say. But you can expect to hear the rainbow voice, the sound of the overtone chant singing with the tibetan bowls. You won't be able to tell which is which but this is all part of the dance. You will even feel what it's like to have the bowls played on you as the sound moves your energy where it needs to go. Tingshas, tuning forks, rattles and more are all part of the play as the sound moves you to rest at your destination without ever having moved. So, please, come and feel something unique. You never leave anywhere exactly the same, but when it comes to sound healing, you will leave sounding more like yourself :)

Pllease bring a blanket to enhance the comfort of your experience! Offerings are freely accepted :)


Much love,


Brian Russo

(781)[masked]

[masked]

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/BeSoundNow"></a>

results.name: Half Moon Healing
