results.description:
Kabbalah is more ancient than any particular religion, and transcends religions and philosophies to bring about a pure transformation of the Self. The Tree of Life is the essential structure of creation and our divine essence as human beings, and a whole lot more.

Universal Kabbalah is the most practical tool available on Earth for creating a productive, grounded, and practical life -- for accomplishing your true purpose, for alchemically transmuting any challenge, and bringing about a new way of harmonious fulfillment of your true purpose.

Join us for this experiential and intense, transformational meditation using various aspects of the Tree of Life:

* Discover the structure of the Soul
* Create from your true will
* Learn to bring inspiration into reality to create a better life and a better world
* Meditate with the Tree of Life
* Reveal your unique gifts
* Expand your conscious personal development into new realms

This Introduction + Meditation is different and unique each week. It is open to all, but is intended for those who have prior experience with meditation and personal development. Your first visit to this class is FREE if you are new to our center. Normally: $20 / $15 if you post about this class on your facebook wall and tag "Greater Boston Center for Advanced Spiritual Healing and Training" in your post.

Register here using our secure online system: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=141093&stype=-8&sTG=23&sVT=57&sView=day&date=12/18/15

BIO for Jordan Bain:

Hi, I'm Jordan. I am a Certified and Initiated Modern Mystery School Guide, Healer, and 3rd step Celtic Shaman Ritual Master. Since my teenage years, I've devoted my life to helping people know themselves and live their higher life purpose. I've studied in many spiritual traditions and offer tools for personal and planetary healing.

Since 2004, I've had the honor and joy of working with over a thousand individual clients, plus many more in meditations and group classes. I've found that disconnection from self and purpose is the #1 reason why people seek healing. In my experience, joy is a process of deepening how much you know yourself, how much you're in alignment with your purpose, and how much service you are doing in the world.
results.name: Tree of Life Meditation and Journey

Dance with us from 8:30pm - midnight at The First Parish Cambridge Unitarian Universalist Church at 3 Church St., Cambridge, MA.

The fabulous, fun-filled event begins at  8:30 and continues with dj'd dancing until  11:30 pm music provided by some extraordinary DJs.  

Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke and alcohol free environment. Children are welcome.

Dance Friday is an activity of the non-profit Movement Collective. Suggested Donation: $15 8pm-9:15, $10-15 after 9:30, $5-10 after 11,  under  23 years old $5-15, or donate 45 minutes of your time to help out.  We recommend casual, light-weight, comfortable clothing that you can  move in.

For more information, please call: 6I[masked], go to <a>www.dancefriday.org,</a> or visit us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/#/pages/Dance-Friday/[masked]?ref=ts

Leah C-S (whose DJ name is Leviathan) is a local freelance photographer, artist and musician. She plays alt pop and texture pop, ranging from ecstatic to trance to rock.

DJ Mystical Michael has been a DJ for more than thirty years, beginning with turntables, then moving to CDs and now digital on his MacBook. He plays a global and eclectic mix of rhythms and tempos to provide opportunities for creative and fun movement including American Pop, R&B, Rock, Dance, Deep House, Deep Chillout and orchestral music.

Michael has been a Reiki Teaching Master and Counselor for more than twenty years. He is Director of Providence Zen Center in addition to a Life Coaching and Reiki Counseling private practice.

By signing up and/or attending a Boston Area Photography Group meetup you agree to the Boston Area Photography Group Disclaimer below.

No guests are permitted on Boston Area Photography Group events. Please have your guests join our Meetup. 

MEETUP DESCRIPTION: Lets shoot this historic neighborhood before dawn... capture bursts from gas lamps on cobble streets, capture holiday decorations, and more... We'll wonder some of the most photographed streets and capture quaint images free of pedestrians. Hopefully we'll have precipatation in the form of frost or dare I say the "S" word to cast reflections for us.

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]

=====

I am using my phone (no guidebook or map) so this is a quick update - instead of Jefferson, Adams, and Madison tomorrow we will be doing Passaconaway and Whiteface. We will do the loop counterclockwise using the Old Mast Road Trail. I will update with more details later. It's about 8.5 miles and should take us about 8 hours. We will begin at 8:30 from the Ferncroft Trailhead - Ferncroft Road leaves NH 113A at Wonalancet village, at a right-angle turn in the main highway; at 0.5 miles from NH 113A, a gravel road (FR 337) turns right and reaches a parking area and kiosk in 0.1 mile. If you are a yes and still want to go great. If you can't make it please change your rsvp so I know who to expect.

==========

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 10 people. 

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you. 

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.

=== What to Bring ===

IT'S WINTER IN THE MOUNTAINS - WINTER CLOTHING AND GEAR IS REQUIRED FOR THIS HIKE. DON'T THINK WE WILL NEED SNOWSHOES BUT WINTER BOOTS, TRACTION (E.G. KAHTOOLA MICROSPIKES OR HILLSOUND TRAIL CRAMPONS), AND WEATHER APPROPRIATE CLOTHING IS REQUIRED. PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE IN WINTER IS ALSO REQUIRED.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike:

http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course (if you go at least 8 miles - 4 out and 4 back).  Some of the Boston Marathon charity runners are out already, so the atmosphere is fun!

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM.  We will leave right at 8:30 AM (especially when it is cold out!).

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!

results.description:
Note:  You must sign up at www.llbean.com/dedham to reserve your spot.  See note at end of description

Join L.L.Bean Dedham for a trip to Purgatory Chasm in Rocky Woods Reservation in Medfield, MA. This trip will pass several ponds, go through open woods and ascend through the rocky and narrow Purgatory Chasm, finally terminating at the summit with its open view to the Southwest.

If you haven't done this hike before, it's easy to moderate and has a lot of variety of terrain.  The chasm and the summit are real fun.  The hike is around 4 miles total.

Bring weather appropriate clothing, water for 2 and a half hours, hiking worthy footwear, bug repellent (there's a lot of deer in Rocky Woods), snacks.

Rocky Woods Reservation is a Trustees site and admittance is $4 for non-members or free if you are a member.

Note:  This meetup attendee list will always list ONE person (the organizer), with the meetup being "FULL".  This is to ensure that attendees sign up at www.llbean.com/dedham to sign up.  We do this so there aren't TWO competing attendee lists (one meetup, one llbean).  See you there!

results.name: Hike the Purgatory Chasm at Rocky Woods Reservation

results.description:
Their major issue is that they have tons of donations, and not even close enough amount of volunteers, to sort useable vs. recycle goods.  

http://thewishproject.org/

The Wish Project is a non-profit dedicated to providing free furniture, home goods, baby goods, and clothing to people in need in the Merrimack Valley, primarily through reuse and recycling. They serve thousands of people each year, and rely on the help of many volunteers. Let's be some of those volunteers! We'll take on whatever task they need on this day, but generally it involves sorting and organizing donations so they can be given out to clients. Children ages 8+ are welcome to join the effort. It's a great opportunity to teach your kids compassion in a very hands-on way. 

IMPORTANT:

If you are bringing children, please make a note in the comments section so I can give the Wish Project an accurate count of adults and kids who will be attending.

http://thewishproject.org/

 *PLEASE NOTE:  When you RSVP 'yes' it becomes a commitment. I am in contact with the volunteer coordinator, Patty, whom is now a member, giving her a head count. She then creates a list of things that need to be done -relying upon the number of volunteers. If your plans change, please be considerate -take a moment to update your RSVP to 'no.' It's very simple- and greatly appreciated! Thanks :)

results.description:
• [Don't be concerned if you don't see many RSVPs here... our members tend to RSVP via our members site at WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org.]

Please arrive at 9:00 am. From 9 to 9:15 am, we set up the meeting and network. We start the meeting at 9:15 am, and continue until 10:45 am. When you enter Church of the Good Shepherd, walk downstairs and take a left. If you arrive late, just walk in and have a seat at any open spot.

Please visit "Meeting Roles & Responsibilities" for more information about what to expect from a club meeting.

Here's a sample agenda for our meeting:

9:00 AM Setting up/Networking

9:15 AM President's Greeting and Club announcements

President opens meeting and welcomes guests

Toastmaster's Welcome

Introduces each role, its purpose, and the person who will perform the role.

Humorist/Invocation

Starts the meeting on a light-hearted note.

Grammarian's Word of the Day

Encourages each of us to add a new word to our vocabularies. Challenge us to use the new word spontaneously.

Scheduled Speeches

Club members give the speeches that they've scheduled and prepared in advance using the guidelines from one of the Toastmasters International communication manuals.

Table Topics

Our meeting's Topicsmaster provides our members and guests with an opportunity for demonstrating and honing their skills for impromptu speaking.

General Evaluator's Introduction

Introduces evaluation team members and evaluate the evaluators and the meeting in general.

Speech Evaluations

Club members provide helpful, supportive feedback to each of the scheduled speaker in a positive and friendly manner.

Grammarian's Report

Grammarian reports on how many times speakers used the Word of the Day and how we used the English language.

Ah-Counter's Report

Ah-counter reports how many filler-words and false starts were used by each participant, to raise speakers' awareness of these instances and to encourage improvement.

Timer's Report

Timer reports speaking times of all major speaking roles to encourage members learn to accomplish tasks within set time limits.

General Evaluator's Report

General evaluator provides a review of the meeting, what went well, and areas for improvement to encourage continual growth and an optimal quality of our meetings.

Toastmaster's Closing Remarks

10:45 AM President Adjourns Meeting

We usually have a convivial lunch at The Red Lentil. Hang around after the meeting for details.

WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org

<a href="http://watertownsaturdaytoastmasters.org/"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: When you enter Church of the Good Shepherd, walk downstairs and take a left.
results.name: Watertown Saturday Toastmasters Club Meeting

results.description:
What better way to usher in Xmas week than to get away from the mall craziness and trek through one of New England's finest rhododendron stands along with some elevation gain along the Metacomet-Monadnock Trail.

The proposed approximately 6-mile hike (elevation gain: 683 ‘) is a loop circumnavigating Little Monadnock Mtn. (1883'), North Meadows (1740'), and Rhododendron Forest (1200') with an extension along a section of the Metacomet-Monadnock Trail. This loop is located mostly in Rhododendron State Park in Fitzwilliam, New Hampshire, famous for its 16-acre stand of native rhododendron and open ledge overlooks.


What you need to know: 

Distance: Approximately 6 miles round trip, but this is subject to change depending on weather, trail conditions and other factors.

Elevation Gain: 700 feet (cumulative) 


Hike Time: Estimated  4 hours. However, this is an estimate. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day. The Organizer is not responsible for getting you back in time. 

Anticipate Pace: 2-2.5 mph or the pace of the slowest hiker

Hike Type:  Loop

Terrain Difficulty Rating: Moderate: Hikes rated as "moderate" usually gain[masked] feet per mile. Moderate hikes usually ascend steadily at an incline that would be difficult for an unconditioned person to comfortably handle. This trek is suitable for intermediate level hikers and beginning hikers who keep in fit condition doing other things. 


Remember that the Difficulty Rating is for the terrain; not the hike itself. When determining if a hike is right for you, remember to factor in: terrain, distance, estimated pace, duration, weather prediction, driving time and your fitness level as well as your mood and frustration threshold..

There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgment. Anyone with recurrent "No Shows" or about whom we have received complaints from fellow hikers will not be accepted. If you haven't hiked with us before, add yourself to the list if you can adhere to these basic prerequisites. 

Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. We are committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up.

 Please do not show up for an event unexpected or unprepared. Bring water (2 liters), hiking boots (not sneakers) and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers. 


This is winter hiking season. Bring your microspikes even if it hasn't snowed. Ice can form even at moderate elevations. Bring a headlamp just in case. Both of these winter hiking essentials can be purchased at REI or EMS. 

Read "Winter Day Hiking Essentials"in the Pages before signing up for this and all winter hikes.

We hike in light rain or light snow, but heavy rain or snow or any  extreme weather that make hiking and/or driving conditions hazardous cancels.

 This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy rain or extreme temperature cancels. 

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event. 

Please remember that your Event Organizers  are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you. 

Short Version: This not an event for high-maintenance individuals.

By signing up and/or attending this hike you agree to the Liability Waiver Below: 
Remember: Your Event Organizers  are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at <a>www.hikesafe.com; </a>you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.

If you are offering or need a ride, post that on the message board. However, when responding please do so privately by clicking on the person's profile pick and clicking the "message" link.

For more information and a trail map go to:http://www.hikenewengland.com/LittleMonadnockRhododendronNH080712.html

http://www.nhstateparks.org/explore/state-parks/rhododendron-state-park.aspx

Directions to the Rhododendron State Park:

Take MA-2 W.

Take exit 24B to merge onto MA-140 N toward Ashburnham/Winchendon

Continue onto MA-12 N and  NH-12 N

Drive for 5.4 miles after entering NH and the take slight left onto 119W

Drive for 2.2 miles and take 3rd right onto Rhododendron Road

Drive for 2 miles and take right onto Rockwood Road

Take a sharp left into the dirt parking lot.
results.name: Pre-Xmas Trek: Rhododendron State Forest/ Little Monadnock/North Meadow Ridge

results.description:
Meet to paint the model for a three week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $50, non-members for $65.    Three hours each Saturday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so here on meetup.

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:30 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $50 or $65 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

If there's no parking in Thorndike lot, look for parking on the side streets.

results.description:
Every Saturday morning at 10:00 AM we gather for a fun, calming group run at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir. Both walkers and runners are welcome. Our main goal is to socialize and support one another!

The Boston Bulldogs is a co-ed non-profit running club founded to support those battling addiction and in recovery, those who have been affected by addiction and their supporters.

We welcome and encourage runners of all levels – dreamers, beginners, as well as those with running experience, past or present. Our volunteer runners will be there to coach you at your current level, and help you meet your goals. We might even be able to help with running gear if needed. 

We meet twice weekly at the Chestnut Hill Reservoir (Cleveland Circle/Reservoir Green Line C or D train) -- on Saturday mornings at 10:00 AM and Thursday evenings at 6:30 PM. We first gather in front of the Cleveland Circle Starbucks, before heading over to the reservoir. See you there!

If you are interested in becoming a member or a volunteer, in making a contribution to the Club, in sponsoring a runner in recovery, or in learning more about the Boston Bulldog educational wellness/running program, contact us at:

• Website - BostonBulldogsRunning.com

• Email - [masked] 

• Phone -[masked]

results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive input and feedback. We usually do the reporting and input/feedback in small groups of 3-4 people. If you can't stay until 12:30, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one! (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability/support session before.) Also, feel free to bring any writings or objects you want to share as part of your anti-racism thinking and work.

We are now scheduling one accountability/support session each month, as we were not getting folks for both sessions. If you are unable to attend and want to be part of accountability, we will consider scheduling an additional session for this month, or choosing a time that works for you in the next month.

For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions." Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role. You still need to have met the requirement of having attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.

This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy.

results.description:
Hi all, 

A friend of mine from back home recently has been diagnosed with a condition known as cardiomyopathy, and has been given a Left Ventricle Assist Device or LVAD to aid her heart function until she receives a heart transplant. 

This Halloween, we will be hosting a costume-themed charity workout to show our support for Olivia, and raise money for her various medical and living expenses. To fully understand why we are hosting this charity, you must first understand her story:

From her sister, Sofia Hart:

"Olivia always thrived to do the best she could. Being gifted with horse back riding as our hobby (or life passion) growing up, she was incredibly fearless and passionate with everything in her. She was also happy to be a Vineyarder during her years playing Hockey and Soccer, representing the place she loved most, home. Her determination was unstoppable on and off horse back, the field, and the ice. These characteristics followed her through her life growing into adulthood. 

As a recent University of Vermont graduate, she did just the same in her studies. When she felt defeated, she would do everything in her power to figure out what went wrong, and how she could fix her mistakes. While at her graduation, tears of joy were brought to my eyes as she smiled receiving her achievements and laughed and hugged with friends. Not only was she proud of herself, but she was even more proud of the people who surrounded her and their accomplishments too.

These qualities and characteristics went even further into the workplace. As a former employee of the Homeport Resturant, she used the skills and experience she learned there and carried it to the Seafood Shanty. Each and every job she has held has meant so much to her. Good days and bad days, she always would talk so highly of her job, especially for how dedicated she was to each establishment. 

Through hardwork, fearlessness, dedication and most importantly, love, Olivia has gained a rather admirable reputation growing up on Martha's Vineyard for 22 years, and at UVM during her college years. 

These amazing qualities and characteristics have not diminished one bit during these tough times. Her spirit is incredibly high, and she shocks us on a daily basis how positive her attitude is. I can not imagine being in her place, and handling the news she gets on a daily basis. Although she has received bad news many times, her positive outlook has not changed. Olivia is determined as ever, looking toward the brightest future."

Here is more on Olivias condition, with a post from her Facebook page:

"So here it is. On the 9th I was transported to Massachusetts General Hospital and diagnosed with a condition known as cardiomyopathy which is a disease of the heart muscle. There is damage to both the right and left portions but the majority of the damage is in the left ventricle. It wasn't until I had a cardiac MRI that the doctors realized my condition was most likely irreversible. The doctors believe it either began years ago when I most likely contracted a viral infection that attacked my heart or may have been something I was born with... the overall cause is unknown. My age enabled me to live and thrive with the condition until a couple of months ago. Currently, I am in the process of being placed on the heart transplant list, which I will hopefully be accepted to by the end of the week, and will receive a new heart by the start of the new year. For now that is about all that we know."

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

When - October 31st, 11:00am

What to bring - This will be a costume workout, so please wear an AWESOME halloween costume. Superheros are strongly encouraged. Water and post-workout nutrition will be provided with each donation.

results.description:
The Israelite nation was developing its own identity and culture, but they were on the brink of destruction. The people wanted to find respect and recognition on the world stage, to feel secure and powerful, and to be prosperous and comfortable in their own homes.  But this was at a time when everyone was doing what was right in their own eyes.  Doesn't sound so different from today, does it?  But God wants to show us a better way--a man who will do all his will, a king after God's own heart.

Join us as we investigate the story of 1 Samuel and the different lessons for us!

Greater Boston Sickle Cell Disease Association, Inc (GBSCDA) in partnership with M.W. Prince Hall Grand Lodge presents their annual Holiday Party For Children with Sickle Cell Disease (SCD)

DATE: Saturday December 19, 2015

TIME: 11:00 AM - 5:00 PM

PLACE: Prince Hall Grand Lodge 24 Washington Street, Dorchester, MA 02121

During the holiday season, it can be very stressful for patients who suffer from (SCD). Many are often hospitalized due to the cold weather, which can trigger sickle cell crises. GBSCDA's goal, as always, is to bring good cheer and happiness to patients and families affected by SCD.

This will be a fun time with live performances and lots of activities for children including:

Music by DJ Jeremy

Dancing

Singing

Facepainting

Hole in the Wall Gang Camp

Volunteers help make this event a very special time for the children

Volunteer Roles:

1) Pick Up Food & Set Up

from 11:00 AM until 1:00 PM

2) Registration, Assist with Activities, Servers, Runners

from 1:00 PM until 4:00 PM

3) Santa's Helpers, Servers, Clean Up

from 3:00 PM until 5:00 PM

Volunteers are also needed to wrap gifts on

December 16th, 17th and 18th between 5:00 PM and 8:00 PM

To VOLUNTEER (mention you're an Onyxbird)

or

to register a child

call[masked] or email [masked]

This is an event for patients and families affected by Sickle Cell Disease
REGISTRATION FOR EVERY CHILD IS NECESSARY!

results.description:
We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

Note: In addition to agreeing to the Meetup's Liability Waiver, all members must sign a Waiver of Liability Form in order to use BU's courts. This form is available at the front desk at the FitRec center.  We may ask you for your full name in order to help BU and the meetup comply with the liability procedures.

Let me know if you have any questions and I hope to see you there!

Liability Waiver

By attending a Boston Badminton meetup, you hereby agree to the terms of the following Liability Waiver:

The purpose of the following Liability Waiver is to protect Boston Badminton meetup members and group leaders from liability in case of accident or injury. All members must agree to the Liability Waiver in order to participate in the group and its activities.

As part of my membership to Boston Badminton on Meetup.com (hereinafter “Boston Badminton”), I hereby freely and voluntarily agree to the following Release, Acknowledgment of Risk, and Waiver of Liability:

In consideration of the opportunity to participate in events, activities, classes, and programs conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates in any venue, and to use equipment located therein, I, on behalf of myself and my minor children, do hereby release, hold harmless and forever discharge and agree not to sue Boston Badminton and its trustees, officers, agents, founders, members, volunteers and employees (together, "Meetup.com Group") from any and all claims, responsibilities or liabilities for injury or damages resulting from or arising out of my or my family’s use of, presence in, or participation in activities conducted at any venue rented or owned by Boston Badminton, whether or not caused by the ordinary negligence of Boston Badminton. I understand, recognize and acknowledge that certain activities conducted by Boston Badminton or taking place in venues rented or owned by Boston Badminton are potentially hazardous. I also acknowledge that it is my responsibility to follow instructions for any activity or use of equipment, and to seek help from the volunteers if I have any questions. I further understand that, notwithstanding precautions taken by Boston Badminton, sports and fitness activities involve a risk of injury and/or death. I/we are voluntarily participating in these activities and using equipment and machinery with knowledge of the dangers involved. I hereby agree to expressly assume and accept any and all risks associated with my participation in activities conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates. I have read the foregoing and hereby agree to be bound by same.

results.description:
FIND MORE INFORMATION AND PURCHASE TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cad-101-fundamentals-of-3d-modeling-tickets-19591108533
This class will introduce attendees to the fundamental concepts of what CAD (Computer Aided Drafting/Design) is and how it is useful. We'll discuss the history of various CAD tools, and then focus on one particular piece of software, DesignSpark. Attendees will learn to download, manipulate and modify files from existing libraries, as well as how to construct their own parts from scratch.

Prerequisites:
Windows laptop (can be provided by Lowell Makes with advance notice)
Basic computer literacy
Prior experience with CAD software is helpful, but not required

The software for this class is a version of the 3D CAD system, SpaceClaim, that is available for free under the name DesignSpark Mechanical. Instructions to download and install the software are available here: http://www.rs-online.com/designspark/electronics/eng/tutorial/designspark-mechanical-download-installation-and-activation

If you can come to the class with the software installed, you will be able to move into the training material more quickly. We can help get you set up before the class begins as well.
results.name: CAD 101: Fundamentals of 3D Modeling

There will be no face to face meetup unless we reach 50 RSVPs by Thursday of the week. You must be enrolled in one of the 10 FREE courses below or similar courses. 

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. Please use the questions / answers / discussions below for now. While asking questions, please make reference to the name of the course and the related module within the course. 

Cousera offers the following classes towards obtaining highly valuable knowledge/skills in Data Science Specialization. It is sometimes hard to work on the exercises and homework without the help of an expert.  Receiving one-on-one help from an expert can improve the commitment of finishing the program with accelerated learning. With that in mind, we are experimenting with the following service.


An expert (MS or PhD in Statistics) will answer any question free that takes less than 10 minutes to solve. There are nominal fees for one-on-one interactive help.  Please use the following link to request for help, or just email [masked] or call[masked]-8864.

http://www.tutorteddy.com/courses/coursera-course-help.php

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

R Programming

Getting and Cleaning Data

Exploratory Data Analysis

Reproducible Research

Statistical Inference

Regression Models

Practical Machine Learning

Developing Data Products

Data Science Capstone

I made this one start 15 minutes earlier so that we can get out on deck in time to get a lane or two to ourselves. Hope you all can make it!

---------------


Swimming is great! If you've been feeling like you haven't had enough swimming in your life, come join us this Saturday. We'll have workouts at multiple levels. You should feel comfortable swimming at least a couple lengths continuously.

The pool opens at 2pm, so we'll meet to go in around 1:45 so that we can be out on the pool deck by 2. $6 to get in, Cambridge residents $5 (or you can buy a 10-pack for an approximate 10% discount, and we do these weekly so you'll have the opportunity to use them up).

Street parking is available but stressful, and the 69 bus drops off down the block, or you can bike or run there and do 2/3 of a triathlon :)

venue.name: Hunnewell Visitor Center at the Arnold Arboretum

results.description:
Winter is coming and the nights are getting longer, which is all the more reason to get outside. Come and join us as we explore the Arnold Arboretum and get to know the many varieties of medicinal tree species growing in Boston.

This time of year, other medicinal plants have passed by and are waiting for the spring to come. Medicinal trees may have lost their leaves, however there are barks and evergreen needles that can still be harvested and made into teas, syrups, tinctures, salves and lotions. Pine, oak, birch, and many, many more species will be discussed, as well as their different preparations and medicinal virtues.

We will be meeting in front of the Hunnewell Visitor’s Center near the main entrance to the Arnold Arboretum, located at 125 the Arborway in Jamaica Plain. A map of our meeting point can be found here:
https://www.google.com/maps?ll=42.304961,-71.121891&z=14&t=m&hl=en&gl=US&mapclient=embed&q=125+Arborway+Boston,+MA+02130

In case of heavy rain, the walk will be rescheduled. If there is light rain or flurries of snow, we will still meet and walk!

The fee for this class is $10. Please rsvp by emailing [masked], or by calling (857) 615-7763.

Saturday, December 19th, 2015
2:00 – 3:30 pm
By the Hunnewell Visitor’s Center
Arnold Arboretum, Boston
results.name: Medicinal Tree Identification Walk

results.description:
Though the time says 2:00, I will try to arrive there by at least 1:30, so do feel free to arrive by then. You can text[masked] or[masked] if you are ever confused about where to go.

Direction:


If you are coming by subway, we suggest you to stop at the Copley Station through green line.


And head to the Boylston street entrance of Boston Public Library. Which is on the side of the library and NOT THE FRONT. Though the whole entrance is in renovation,  you can still able enter through the entrance. Head to the second floor and you should be able to find us.


The second floor is somewhat large, and the specific location can vary, so please contact us if you are not sure where to find us.

We are usually near the section labeled "QM Anatomy" and "QL Animals" and near the information desk. However, if that table is occupied, we will usually move somewhere else. If that happens, we will comment on this page on where we have moved. If you are unsure, be sure to message or call us!
results.how_to_find_us: Side entrance of Boston Public Library, 2nd floor. Table nearest the Anatomy section. More details in the descrption. Text 919-559-5795 or 857-277-3132

Come and join us for coffee and Latin conversation, no experience necessary! We will start with English introductions and then do a short lectio (Latin reading- feel free to bring a text you are interested in) and then just chat in Latin. Beginners totally welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be speaking Latin :).  Also, if you get there and cannot find anyone post your location in the comments and we will find you.

Don't let the cold keep you cooped up. Get some fresh air, exercise and sanity this holiday season on a hike to to the top of Prospect Hill in Waltham, which has fantastic views of the Boston skyline.

results.description:
Women’s Lodge is listening this year to stories of women who have transmuted violence and betrayal into empowerment: the goddess Sedna, the women worldwide in Half the Sky, and our own selves who have overcome oppression in many forms.   We will join these universal women’s struggles with our voices, our dancing bodies, our silent contemplation and our collective action.

Embracing the nourishing darkness of winter, we will journey into our Mother’s womb for renewal, with spacious time for journaling. If you don’t have a beautiful blank book for your spiritual writing, we encourage you to buy or make one now as a gift to yourself. You may even want to keep a separate journal for inspiration from Women’s Lodge circles!

Those of us who watched part of the Half the Sky video together were inspired by the story of the Kenyan women who, having endured genital mutilation, rape and beatings, formed their own women’s village to raise their children in safety. We are excited to announce that we are adopting the  Umoja Women’s Village as our sister women’s community this year.

We hope you will take a few minutes before our circle to visit 

www.umojawomen.net to learn more, and

www.halftheskymovement.org/pages/rebecca-lolosoli

 to “meet” Rebecca Lolosoli, the brave woman who started Umoja. Here is the link to a video clip of the villagers greeting a visitor with their woman-honoring dance: 

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/lisa-belkin/olivia-wilde-vagina-song-dance-half-the-sky_b_1935591.html

Please bring a donation to support these women and the sister villages that have grown from the original. We will collect cash and make an online group donation.

At 6:00 we will share finger food and our Solstice Marketplace, where you may find the perfect Solstice/Christmas gift. If you have something to sell, please contact Sharon Bauer at 

[masked]

. Ten percent of sales will go to the Ugandan women’s villages. We will also have a Giveaway Blanket – please bring festive, sparkly items to brighten a sister’s winter.

To bring:• Your journal and something to write with
• Two smooth stones to hold in your hands. If you brought an “egg” stone to our Equinox sauna circle, you might want to bring that again. (Your stones will be coming home with you at the end.)
• Clothes in colors of the day or night winter sky
• Warm socks or slippers to keep our dancing floor dry
• A shawl or sweater for warmth and coziness
• A blanket and/or pillow for sitting/lying on the floor
• Drums and rattles
• $15 donation to Women’s Lodge (less if needed, more if able)
• Cash for donating to the Umoja villages
• Cash or checks for buying at the marketplace
• $5 for your copy of Half the Sky if you don’t already have it
• Giveaway and marketplace items
  RSVP to Nouri at [masked] or[masked]-0384. Please let us know if you hope to come, even if you’re not sure.
  In case of snow or ice, we will make a decision by noon on December 19 and send an e-mail to our Spider Grandmother Webletter list, or you may call Nouri between noon and 1:00.
results.name: Women's Lodge Winter Solstice Circle

results.name: Special Program of Month! A Festival of Lights A Celebration of the Holiday Seas

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,


Let's enjoy some holiday lights.  Stoneham Zoo is hosting Zoolights. 

ZooLights promises to dazzle visitors of all ages this holiday season. Enter a winter wonderland of tree-lined paths lit by thousands of twinkling lights. Stroll through festively decorated Yukon Creek, home to bald eagles, Canada lynx, reindeer and arctic foxes.

To avoid traffic and parking problems, I recommend that we meet on the early side.  The venue starts at 5 pm.  Let's meet at 5 pm at the entrance to the venue.  The plan is gather as a group for 15 minutes or so before going into the venue.  I strongly recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance online at http://www.zoonewengland.org/engage/zoolights.  The cost is $7.  

If there is any interest, we could meet at a nearby restaurant or pub after this event.  We can discuss this on the day of the event. 

Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement. For events to be successful, I need to know who to expect and how many.  

This is a public event and you are certainly free to attend this event outside the Meetup group.  I just ask  that only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending this event and intend to meet members of the group.  

If you reserve "YES", we will be expecting you.  If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation. A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group. 

This is should be a fantastic event and look forward to seeing new and familiar faces. 

Joana
results.how_to_find_us: at the entrance
results.name: Zoolights at Stoneham Zoo

results.description:
We will practice together, play and study theory.

Usually we get quite a few beginners, so if you are just starting don't be shy, you definitely can join us. If you have been playing for some time I am sure you will find a few helpful ideas as well. If the level will be very different then we might divide it to two groups eventually.

Half of the class time is dedicated to a consecutive curriculum. We try to choose themes that are relevant to everybody in the class. We might talk about some aspects of technique, or reading, or theory etc. The other half of the class time we usually help students with their individual issues and questions.

We see this class as a supportive and motivational environment for your self-teaching process. There are two experienced guitar teachers (Anastasiya Dumma and David Lee), both Berklee grads, who are ready to answer all your questions and suggest new things to practice!

This is PAY-WHAT-YOU-WANT class. We kindly ask you to support your teachers and Westland Guitars that provided the space. Online donations feel a bit inconvenient (sorry), so you can contribute when you come to the class.
results.how_to_find_us: Westland Guitars is quite easy to find, I believe. For those of you who are familiar with the area it is very close to Whole Foods (across the street) and Symphony Hall. 54B is in the basement and it has its own dedicated entrance.
results.name: Let's make one more step towards guitar mastery.

results.name: Watch Star Wars

results.description:
Not a lot of details are available for the movie yet...but the force is strong in this one.   ;)

We are going to the 7:45PM IMAX 3D showing.   Get your tickets NOW!!!!!  The server keeps crashing as so many people are trying to buy tickets.   Keep trying!!!!   Show up early.   I will be there before 6:30 and will wait near the ropes by the concession stand until they let us into the inner lobby.  If you want to sit with the group COME EARLY!!!

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance.  I will announce when tickets go on sale on Fandango. Please do NOT buy tickets until I have finalized the time.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group. No separate checks.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

results.description:
Let's head over to the StorySlam at Doyle's Cafe to participate or just to enjoy. Every 3rd Saturdays of the month.


7:30pm | Saturday, Dec 19th


December's Theme: Religion 

What is a Story Slam?
A story slam is a competition based on the art of storytelling. It puts a major emphasis on content and secondary on performance, encouraging storytellers to focus on what they’re saying and how they say it. It is an exercise in crafting stories within a set time limit

For More Info:  https://www.facebook.com/storyslam.net

For Schedule and Tickets Link:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/story-slam-sharing-life-the-mic-tickets-18350766637

Need a Laugh? Yummy treats? Free Tickets? Party?

results.description:
* One free drink ticket included

* Saturday edition - Spend your weekend interacting with fun singles instead of staring at your smartphone during Happy Hour.

*Hilarity will ensue, not required but bring an ugly sweater if you can.


Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth.  Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity."  If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker!  It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up.  Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

Agenda:

7:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. - Participants Arrive & Register (If at the door, tickets are available).

7:30 p.m. - 8:45 p.m. - "Cards Against Humanity" begins.

8:45 p.m. - TBD - Raffle Prize

Price:

- $30 at the door (if tickets available)

- $20 pre-paid RSVP *(Limited to 25 male/ 25 female tickets)

Early bird special: 

First 10 to use promocode "earlybird" save $5 off the prepaid price (pay $15 instead of $20).

Pre-pay by CLICKING HERE<a></a>

* Once all 25 male/ 25 female tickets have been sold, we will release more tickets in increments. We are able to hold a maximum of 60 singles (30 males / 30 females)!

Recommended Attire:

Men - Come presentable; highly recommend collared shirt with jeans or slacks.

Women - Come casual but classy; do not have to come in a dress but blouses recommended over shirts.

DANCE BY THE SEA @ The  Ashworth Hotel!!!

The hotel will be beautifully decorated for The Holidays! 

DINNER: SORRY, AS OF 12/18  OUR GROUP(S) RESERVATION  HAS HIT FULL CAPACITY. THE HOTEL WILL NOT ALLOW ME ANY MORE SPOTS. If you want to have dinner? Sorry, but you would have to call Breakers and make your own reservation.  http://www.ashworthhotel.com/eat-en.html ( hopefully this link will take you to the menu)

DANCING:  The DJ starts a 9 pm. and plays a wide range of music that will have you up dancing! NO COVER

COST: Pay for your own food/drinks. No Cover Charge

*This is a cross-posted event with other meet up groups & the RSVP list is growing!!!

* PLEASE NOTE: We want our groups to always be welcome - and also fair to the wait staff! So, PLEASE  be sure to purchase a beverage/food item or both. Sorry, water does not count unless it costs money. Thanks for your understanding : - )

* SOME from the other groups invited have chosen to rent rooms for the night. The average cost is anywhere from $99. - $140. per night ( not including tax and any other charges). To make YOUR OWN reservation, please contact the hotel directly. www.ashworthhotel.com Sorry, this is on a first-come-first served basis - there are no rooms set aside for our groups.

results.name: Holiday Party

results.description:
A quick trip to sunny Spain would be just the thing in December, no?  The next best thing is to share some tempranillo wines by the fire with some fun friends.  I really hope that you can make room in your holiday schedule to join us!


A native variety of Spain, Tempranillo means "little early one," which refers to the grape's early ripening tendency.  My favorites are from Ribera del Duero, but it is also the main grape used in Rioja, and is often referred to as Spain's noble grape. The grape has been planted throughout the globe in places such as Mexico, New Zealand, California, Washington State, South Africa, Texas, Australia, Argentina, Portugal and Arizona.  I always think it is interesting to see what a difference terroir makes, so go ahead and look far and wide.  Please plan to spend $15-25.

Tempranillo is a very food friendly wine.  I will make a big pasta dish (or something) and the you are all welcome to bring an appetizer to share.

Please notice that this meetup is in Medfield and is not accessible by public transportation.


Two spots will be saved for members who have not yet attended a blind wine tasting.
results.name: Tempranillo by the Fire

TWO days until our annual Christmas Party! This is such a fun night and this year we have the added "gift" of having Gay Barboza perform just for us!! So if you haven't gotten your ticket yet, add that to your "to-do list". You may also pay at the door Saturday night although paying ahead is preferable (just makes it easier for me that night!) You don't want to miss this fantastic night filled with lots of fun, food, great music, and  holiday cheer!  A guaranteed great time will be had by all!!

***I'm getting a little concerned about the food...only a handful of people have listed what they are bringing below. Please bring your favorite dish to share (and your choice of drink!) If you haven't signed up yet with what you will be bringing, please do so below - just so we make sure we end up with a nice variety of food!! Last year's food was incredible!

Also, just like last year, we will have an optional Yankee Gift Swap with a $20 limit (NO JOKE GIFTS PLEASE)! We had a lot of fun with this last year!!

Can't wait to see everyone Saturday!!!!!!

The cost will be $25.00 which will cover the cost of the room and the entertainment! PLEASE DO NOT RSVP HERE UNTIL YOU HAVE PAID! If you would like to join us, the easiest way to do this is through PayPal. If you don't already have a PayPal account, you will need to create one - IT'S FREE! Below are the instructions sent to me directly from PayPal:

Here’s how:
Log in to your PayPal account.
Click Send & Request at the top of the page.
Click Send money to friends or family.
Enter my email address ([masked]) and the amount and click Next.
Choose your payment method, leave a note if you like and review the payment details.
Click Send to complete the payment.
We’ll send the recipient an email letting them know that you sent them money. If they don’t have a PayPal account, we explain how to sign up for one.

Sincerely,
Izza Rinna
PayPal Customer Solutions
PayPal

If for some reason you don't want to use PayPal then you can message me on here and we can make arrangements to meet.

***AGAIN PLEASE ONLY RSVP here once you have paid  
Thanks everyone!

results.description:
This tr. offers some of the best views in the Fells! Living up to its name it is very rocky and offers rewarding but rugged hiking!! Book says 4 mi. 3.5 hrs

This hike is rated hard/intermediate, This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy snow or extreme cold weather cancels. Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

Please remember that your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below:

Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
We will hike Hickory Hills Forest. This is approx 4 miles round trip and takes just about an hour and fifteen minutes. It is a nice hike mostly on Cart paths. We will meet at 156 S. Row Road, in Lunenburg Hike over to the trail head and make our way around the forest. Wear sturdy shoes or boots. Socially behaved dogs are welcome, please bring your own doggie bags.
Directions.
From the center of Lunenburg
Rte 2A East Approx 3/4 mile turn left onto Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx 1/2 mile on Townsend Harbor Road to the stop sign. Turn left at the stop sign to continue on Townsend Harbor Road.
Travel approx another 1/2 mile at the fork stay left onto South Row Road. Follow South Row Road for approx 1/2 mile.
My house is on the right.
Uturn Driveway, Brown house. Pull right into the driveway.

Meet to paint the model for a four week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $65, non-members for $75.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $65 or $75 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
Christmas in the City is an event geared to helping families living in shelters. Its goal in to spread the Christmas spirit among families and kids in need.

This shift is all day from 9:45am till 4:45pm. Christmas in the City asked for no shorter shifts. As a volunteer you will be helping with one of the shelters, under a shelter captain, to make the day as special as possible for the children and their families: helping welcome them, serving food, taking them around to all the activities at the party including taking the children Winter Wonderland where the games and rides are, distributing the wish list gifts after Santa comes and so forth. It is a long day but very rewarding! They need as many volunteers so please ask your friends and co workers if they can help.

If you sign up on Saturday the details are posted in the Discussion Board of the Single Volunteers Boston meetup
results.how_to_find_us: Volunteer Check in the Convention Center - Details were emailed to volunteers.
results.name: Help at Christmas in the City

results.description:
Over the years that Photography workshops has been in existence many of you have asked me to demonstrate my post-processing techniques for portraits. 

I have generally resisted, not because I want to be difficult but because a certain amount of how I post-process is rather intuitive and can't easily be broken down into individual easy to understand teachable steps. 

Additionally, much of it involves the use of multiple and complex sets of blended Photoshop Layers and the occasional use of plugins such as Nik and several regularly used Photoshop actions.

That said, after several years of pondering how to teach a class on this, I believe I have managed to come up with an approach that will work. 

Join me in this three hour introduction in which I will walk you through how to post-process your portraits to produce high quality results. 

 The techniques  taught will be based on easily adapted features of Lightroom and Photoshop. 

It's a trial run so I am keeping the cost low. ($20) 

You are welcome to bring along a lap-top to follow-along.
results.how_to_find_us: Enter through the EMTS Door and head to SUITE 12 on the second floor.
results.name: Post Processing the Portrait

results.description:
Tired of wrapping presents? Want to make room for more candy canes and fruitcake? Join me for a holiday hike!  After the hike we'll head somewhere local for lunch and libations. 

Covering 1,027 acres in Foxboro and Wrentham, F. Gilbert Hills State Forest is a passive use pine and oak forest.  There are approximately 23 miles of trails for various uses throughout the property.  One of these is the Warner Trail, a long-distance hiking trail that travels through Norfolk County on its way to Rhode Island.  


I'm planning approximately 2 hours for the hike. However, any time estimate given is just that. Actual times vary greatly according to weather, trail conditions and the group itself. Please don't sign up if you've scheduled something later in the day. I am not responsible for getting you back in time. There is no way of knowing trail conditions ahead of time. Use your own judgment. 

No dogs are allowed on hikes. 

Please remember that I am a volunteer, the event is free, and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below:  Remember: I am a volunteer. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason.

results.description:
Greater Boston Oasis meets every week for engaging speakers, live musicians, and the opportunity to connect with the community. Details of the speakers, musical guests, etc. will be posted in the individual meetups as they are confirmed.

Doors for the event open at 10:00 AM for coffee and conversation, with the program starting at 10:30. We hope to see you there!

=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 

Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs


Reality is known through reason


Meaning comes from making a difference


Human hands solve human problems


Be accepting, and be accepted

Atheist or agnostic, freethinker or skeptic, deist or theist, all those with whom those values resonate are welcome to celebrate the human experience.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow signs from the entrance to the Teen Center room. Use the Dartmouth Street entrance, and head to Stairwell B. Teen Center is on the 2nd floor.

with additional material from Meyer’s 1560 work

https://sites.google.com/site/jochimmeyer1560/home/Meyer_1560_english_Maurer_2012.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1

From Jakob Sutor’s “New Illustrated Fechtbuch” of 1612

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bxqzt-jcOCFsT19Xa1Q2QXltWm8/edit

Finally some from

Cod.Guelf.83.4 Aug.8º

results.description: Sunday Morning Practice combines study and practice of meditation with reading and discussion about Tibetan Buddhism. It is relaxed and informal; questions and discussion are welcome. We will read and discuss a selection of stories from the famous "100,000 Songs of Milarepa". In addition to being lively and entertaining, these wonderful stories contain very direct instructions on Dharma practice at all levels from beginner to advanced, from Tibet's most famous Yogi. As Garchen Rinpoche once said, "There is no greater Guru than Milarepa".  We will also learn and practice several types of meditation, including calm abiding as well as more advanced meditation practices.
results.how_to_find_us: Near Whole Foods off Massachusetts Ave in Arlington

results.description:
OM (Orgasmic Meditation) is a simple way for people to practice their orgasm. It's like....yoga for your orgasm. And, the more you practice, the more you feel.


The Intro To OM Class is the perfect way to learn OneTaste's signature practice of OM, a simple practice with revolutionary results. Learn how to feel more, connect more deeply to your partner, and enliven your sex in just fifteen minutes a day.

The course will include:
- The philosophy behind OM
- Introduction of a new definition of Orgasm: the difference between Climax and Orgasm
- Exploration of OneTaste principles: Attention, Simplicity & Desire and how they relate to your OM practice
- The benefits of an OM practice
- Live demonstration of OM
- Basic stroking technique
- A chance to have your first OM with the guidance of trained OneTaste coaches (the "OM Lab")


Intro To OM is a great starting point for both men and women, single or coupled, and will give you the right foundation to begin building your OM practice and cultivating your Orgasm.

Open to singles and couples ages 18+ (adults of all genders)
Returning OMers are also welcome - come brush up on your skills!
Pre-requisite: Watch the How to OM Video (available at http://onetaste.us/welcome/)

Intro To OM Course Details:
- Price: $197/person
- 6 hours total includes course, lunch break, and optional OM Lab after the course.


After the class, you can:
- Start your OM practice: we recommend at least three times a week!
- Attend OM Circles (where the community comes together for guided practice) anywhere in the world!
- Join OM Practice Club: a weekly session with local OM coaches to deepen your understanding of OM and increase your facility with the practice. 
- Join the OM Hub: a social network for OMers, where you can interact with OMers in your community and beyond about all things OM!

Registration:
You must register at the eventbrite site - RSVPing on the Meetup page does not hold you a spot, and space is limited.

SO excited to welcome new OMers to the community!

To register for the course, please go to: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-intro-to-om-orgasmic-meditation-122015-tickets-19664197143
results.name: Intro To OM Class!

results.description:
What to expect: This monthly meeting typically begins with an introduction all around for the benefit of any first-time attendees, and discussion of any announcements, upcoming events, etc. We then move on to a topic of interest to atheists (usually) chosen beforehand. Sometimes participants bring print-outs of articles, research, or books to share on the topic, and sometimes people just come with a story or opinion to share.

We loosely moderate the topical discussion to give everyone a chance to participate. Then the conversation often flows onto other related subjects, sometimes in smaller conversation groups around the table.

If you have any ideas for meeting topics, please let any of the co-organizers know. We can also add announcements or "mini-topics" on the agenda if there's anything you'd like to share with the group.

Looking forward to meeting you - ma'a salaame!!

results.description:
Join us on court this Sunday at 11 a.m. for the start of this spring season's Beginner Level Group Tennis Clinics conducted by highly experience tennis professionals.


This weekly (every Sunday) series of group clinics is a 6-session, 9 hour (each session runs 90 minutes) series of clinics designed for beginner level tennis players.

The fundamentals of tennis will be covered throughout the series in a format that will utilize precise tennis drills and clear description of fundamentally correct tennis technique to reinforce these tennis essentials with each participating player.

Each 90-minute session in the series will include: warm-up exercises; dynamic stretching; cardio drills; skill-building tennis drills; description and demonstration of fundamentally sound tennis strokes.

Each participant will get to hit many balls during drills under the watchful eye of the supervising tennis pro.

We have priced this series of clinics at the handsomely discounted, cost-friendly rate of just $135. That averages a very low $15/hr/player.

Learn the game of tennis or improve your beginner level strokes. In these clinics, you'll do just that and, at the same time, increase your enjoyment of tennis.

Make this the year you take your tennis game to the next level!

GET TOGETHER ONLY FOR GREEK ISLAND CRUISER'S 

GREEK LANGUAGE/CULTURE LESSON AND BRUNCH!!!

Just as promised by NSS for those that have booked for the cruise: JOIN NORTH SHORE SOCIAL AND EIRINI KAY ON A DREAM CRUISE TO THE GREEK ISLANDS!!!

MORE INFO ON CRUISE CALL CARLA AT: [masked] 


We will be meeting at Family Fare (Peabody) for brunch in their private family room.

 Eirini Kay will be giving a little back round of Greek culture and some basic Greek phrases that will make our cruise even more memorable.

Please bring: Note book, pen or pencil, a good appetite and lots of humor. Be prepared to laugh your pants off, trying to pronounce many of the Greek words!

 This get together will also give you the  chance to meet your fellow travelers and find room mates if you need too!

Family Fare will allow us to use their family room free of charge as long as all attending, eat well we are there. Please make sure to tip our servers well!

FAMILY FARE MENU OPTIONS: BREAKFAST AND LUNCH

Please note we have about 50 people signed up to travel with us on the Greek Island Cruise and this event will only have a limit of 10 spaces. I will try to have one a month till May when we leave.

SO PLEASE do not RSVP yes, in less you are quite sure you can attend. We understand things happen so please have an updated RSVP the latest the day before, so I can have an accurate head count.

 MULTIPLE MEETUP EVENT SPONSORED BY:

 NORTH SHORE SOCIAL

 PLEASE RSVP FOR THIS EVENT IN ONLY ONE GROUP

 AND KEEP YOUR RSVP UP TO DATE!

 Be safe, Yours truly Eirini Kay

  SEE YOU THERE!!!

What our members are saying about North Shore Social:

“Great time. Can't wait until the next adventure”

“Wonderful people having lots of fun. Thank you Eirini for all you do for NSS. You do a fantastic job at organizing the group and your events.”

“The Greek Night Party was so much fun. Thank you so much. The food Eirini cooked was out of this world. Eirini did such a good job organizing the event and making sure everyone had a blast. I would recommend North Shore Social to everyone.”

Need a little more convincing?

Click here to see the rest of our 90+ testimonials!

Please bring: Note book, pen or pencil, a good appetite and lots of humor. Be prepared to laugh your pants off, trying to pronounce many of the Greek words!

 This get together will also give you the  chance to meet your fellow travelers and find room mates if you need too!

Family Fare will allow us to use their family room free of charge as long as all attending, eat well we are there. Please make sure to tip our servers well!

FAMILY FARE MENU OPTIONS: BREAKFAST AND LUNCH

Please note we have about 50 people signed up to travel with us on the Greek Island Cruise and this event will only have a limit of 10 spaces. I will try to have one a month till May when we leave.

SO PLEASE do not RSVP yes, in less you are quite sure you can attend. We understand things happen so please have an updated RSVP the latest the day before, so I can have an accurate head count.

 MULTIPLE MEETUP EVENT SPONSORED BY:

 NORTH SHORE SOCIAL

 PLEASE RSVP FOR THIS EVENT IN ONLY ONE GROUP

 AND KEEP YOUR RSVP UP TO DATE!

 Be safe, Yours truly Eirini Kay

  SEE YOU THERE!!!

What our members are saying about North Shore Social:

“Great time. Can't wait until the next adventure”

“Wonderful people having lots of fun. Thank you Eirini for all you do for NSS. You do a fantastic job at organizing the group and your events.”

“The Greek Night Party was so much fun. Thank you so much. The food Eirini cooked was out of this world. Eirini did such a good job organizing the event and making sure everyone had a blast. I would recommend North Shore Social to everyone.”

Need a little more convincing?

Click here to see the rest of our 90+ testimonials!
